alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Harrison; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 11:19AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Harrison, Clark, Floyd, southern Scott, southeastern Washington, western Oldham and northwestern Jefferson Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1118 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Scottsburg to 10 miles northwest of New Albany to 11 miles north of Corydon. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Albany around 1135 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Jeffersonville, Louisville, St. Matthews, Shively, Lyndon, Prospect, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, Beechwood Village, Barbourmeade and Northfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
